item.title: ‘Leave no one behind’: As wealth gap widens, UN calls for new industrial deal for world’s poorest
item.description: Ministers and leaders from across the world’s 44 least developed countries have pledged to accelerate industrialisation that benefits all, and strengthen resilience in the face of global challenges, at an international UN conference in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia.

item.title: From silence to strength: Women leaders speak out in South Sudan
item.description: Scolded for wanting to go to school as a girl and dismissed or ignored as an adult, Awrelia from Wau in South Sudan has learnt to advocate for herself, her children and for the women in her community.

item.title: Nigeria: Schools should be ‘sanctuaries not targets’ says deputy UN chief following latest mass abduction
item.description: The UN Deputy Secretary-General voiced deep alarm on Saturday over the latest mass abduction from a school in Nigeria, calling for the immediate release of those taken.

item.title: Belém COP30 delivers climate finance boost and a pledge to plan fossil fuel transition
item.description: In a pivotal outcome at COP30 in Belém, Brazil, countries agreed on a sweeping package to scale up climate finance and accelerate implementation of the Paris Agreement – but without a clear commitment to move away from fossil fuels.
